subject: Re: [junit] Exception is swallowed inside tearDown
msgSnippet: ... Do you /really/ want to invoke tearDown() twice? -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603 Let s
messageBody:
Christian Pekeler wrote:

> Like you, I also consider the test's exception more interesting than
> the follow-up problems in tearDown(). I've fixed it (in
> http://wounittest.sf.net) with the following method in my TestCase
> superclass, which inherits from junit.framework.TestCase.
>
>
> /**
> * Runs the bare test sequence.
> * This overwrites <code>runBare()</code> in <code>TestCase</code>
> such that exceptions in <code>tearDown()</code>
> * are only shown if the test itself didn't throw.
> */
> public void runBare() throws Throwable {
> setUp();
> try {
> runTest();
> } catch (Throwable e) {
> try {
> tearDown();
> } finally {
> throw e;
> }
> }
> tearDown();
> }

Do you /really/ want to invoke tearDown() twice?
--
